intro: Zeuxine formosana, commonly known as the Formosan zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
